word:
Previous to my husband's dangerous and protracted illness, he preformed, for years, more labor than two men should have done 
                                                                           10
in the same time. He could not see any period where he could be relieved from the pressure of care, and obtain mental and physical rest. My husband was warned by testimony of his danger. I was shown that he was doing too much brain labor. I will here copy a written testimony given as far back as Aug. 26, 1855:
